answers.answer: Baby would be considered premature at this point and there is no telling how he'd be. Some babies born at 36 weeks are perfectly fine and others need to spend weeks in the NICU.

It's too early for you to have the baby. Although the baby might be measuring large on the outside, on the inside baby's lungs still aren't fully developed. Being born too early can cause issues such as improper latching with breastfeeding, low birth weight, respiratory illnesses, increased risk of SIDS, to name a few issues that can occur. It's tough  for all of us mama, but you won't be pregnant forever. Hang in there:)

I'm 37+5 and am completely miserable, with signs of possible preeclampsia and I've been on bedrest since 32 weeks do to preterm labor. As frustrated and miserable as I am the new standard for a full-term pregnancy is 39 weeks, and I want my bub to be as healthy as possible. The chance of baby having complications before 39 weeks is very high. Please think of your baby, you've supported this little life this long just a little longer. Its worth all the s**t in the end. Good luck dear.

There's only one person who will decide if they're going to be born and that is the baby!! The longer he is baking in your belly the healthier he's going to be when he's born. I'm 38 weeks so know your frustration but get your rest in, read some books, even pamper yourself. Enjoy your last few weeks..... and swoods7882 good luck to you too

You're baby is fully term by week 37 u can go into labour any time from then right up until you've 42 weeks i would not recommend trying to bring on labour at 36 weeks i know we all get fed up towards the last few weeks i am 38 weeks so I know how you feel but you're wee bambino will make a appearance when he or she is ready to

Well I was in hospital last night with pains and turns out I'm in slow labour but baby is happy and heart beat is really good so hopefully not long I wouldn't put my baby at any risk I just wanted to know if it would be safe to do some of the 'old wives tales' the doctor said to me if he is born he will be perfectly ok as u are classed as full term at week 37 thanks for all ur advice guys xx
Good luck. Look forward to an update xx

question: I want to try and bring labour on I'm 36 weeks will there be a risk to my baby if he's not ready and I go into labour??? Really want him here n I'm measuring a week over but I know they are just estimates just getting fed up and keep getting pains like period pains please help!!! X
title: hi
